content:
Here are some tips to help you remember to use your loyalty cards or apps:

1. **Store loyalty cards in an easy-to-reach spot:** Keep your physical loyalty cards in a designated spot, such as a wallet, purse, or a specific compartment in your bag. This way, you'll be more likely to grab them when you need them.
2. **Set reminders on your phone:** Set reminders on your phone to use your loyalty apps or cards when you're near a specific store or at a certain time of day. You can use built-in reminder apps or third-party apps like AnyList or Habitica.
3. **Create a routine:** Make using your loyalty cards or apps a habit by incorporating them into your daily routine. For example, make it a point to open your loyalty app every time you walk into a store or before you make a purchase.
4. **Visual cues:** Place sticky notes or reminders on your fridge, car dashboard, or near your wallet to remind you to use your loyalty cards or apps.
5. **Link loyalty cards to your credit/debit cards:** If possible, link your loyalty cards to your credit or debit cards. This way, you'll earn points or rewards automatically when you make a purchase.
6. **Use a loyalty card aggregator:** Consider using an app like Stocard or AwardWallet, which allows you to store and manage multiple loyalty cards in one place.
7. **Make it a habit with a buddy:** Share your loyalty goals with a friend or family member and challenge each other to use your loyalty cards or apps regularly.
8. **Leave notes on your phone's lock screen:** Set a note on your phone's lock screen to remind you to use your loyalty app or card when you're out shopping or grabbing coffee.
9. **Use a habit-tracking app:** Apps like Habitica, HabitBull, or Loop Habit Tracker can help you track your daily habits, including using your loyalty cards or apps.
10. **Reward yourself:** Set small rewards for yourself when you reach certain milestones or use your loyalty cards or apps consistently. This will help motivate you to continue the habit.

Choose the method that works best for you, and don't be afraid to experiment with different reminders until you find what sticks!
